text: Hi, i’ve a problem with my HS watcher. When i first run the commando “_npx hs watch projectX projectX” it uploads my files, but when i make changes, it does not activate. I’ve been searching for the problem, but i cannot find it. Anyone who can help me?_

Hello All
Can we add costume class in HubSpot boilerplate?

As Rohan said we encourage using Sandbox accounts for your development. Our recommended workflow:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow>

From that base workflow you may find your individual team works better with some slight changes to it but that should help get you in the right direction.

Thanks <@U0177RKAS1H> and <@U7SL518D6> .  I was thinking of doing the same as  Rohan suggested with one central sandbox for each client site.  Follow-up question regarding content and design.  Can final page layout and content be transferred from account to another or just theme files?  I'm assuming that that information might be in stored in a database and don't know if the database information can be cloned to a new location.

Not sure we havent tried that yet <@U0121BS1ES3> most of the content in dev is just test stuff for us.
The one thing missing in the CLI is the ability to update HubDB tables so that is still quite a manual process
